19.verse: You won’t need the light of the sun or the moon. I, the LORD your God, will be your eternal light and bring you honor.

20.verse: Your sun will never set or your moon go down. I, the LORD, will be your everlasting light, and your days of sorrow will come to an end.

21.verse: Your people will live right and always own the land; they are the trees I planted to bring praise to me.

22.verse: Even the smallest family will be a powerful nation. I am the LORD, and when the time comes, I will quickly do all this.

1.verse: The Good News of Victory - The Spirit of the LORD God has taken control of me! The LORD has chosen and sent me to tell the oppressed the good news, to heal the brokenhearted, and to announce freedom for prisoners and captives.

2.verse: This is the year when the LORD God will show kindness to us and punish our enemies. The LORD has sent me to comfort those who mourn,

3.verse: especially in Jerusalem. He sent me to give them flowers in place of their sorrow, olive oil in place of tears, and joyous praise in place of broken hearts. They will be called “Trees of Justice,” planted by the LORD to honor his name.

4.verse: Then they will rebuild cities that have been in ruins for many generations.

5.verse: They will hire foreigners to take care of their sheep and their vineyards.

6.verse: But they themselves will be priests and servants of the LORD our God. The treasures of the nations will belong to them, and they will be famous.

7.verse: They were terribly insulted and horribly mistreated; now they will be greatly blessed and joyful forever.

8.verse: The LORD Loves Justice - I, the LORD, love justice! But I hate robbery and injustice. My people, I solemnly promise to reward you with an eternal agreement.

9.verse: Your descendants will be known in every nation. All who see them will realize that they have been blessed, by me, the LORD.

10.verse: Celebrate and Shout - I celebrate and shout because of my LORD God. His saving power and justice are the very clothes I wear. They are more beautiful than the jewelry worn by a bride or a groom.

11.verse: The LORD will bring about justice and praise in every nation on earth, like flowers blooming in a garden.

1.verse: Jerusalem Will Be Saved - Jerusalem, I will speak up for your good. I will never be silent till you are safe and secure, sparkling like a flame.

2.verse: Your great victory will be seen by every nation and king; the LORD will even give you a new name.

3.verse: You will be a glorious crown, a royal headband, for the LORD your God.

4.verse: Your name will no longer be “Deserted and Childless,” but “Happily Married.” You will please the LORD; your country will be his bride.

5.verse: Your people will take the land, just as a young man takes a bride. The LORD will be pleased because of you, just as a husband is pleased with his bride.

6.verse: Jerusalem, on your walls I have stationed guards, whose duty it is to speak out day and night, without resting. They must remind the LORD

7.verse: and not let him rest till he makes Jerusalem strong and famous everywhere.

8.verse: The LORD has given his word and made this promise: “Never again will I give to your enemies the grain and grapes for which you struggled.

9.verse: As surely as you harvest your grain and grapes, you will eat your bread with thankful hearts, and you will drink your wine in my temple.”

10.verse: People of Jerusalem, open your gates! Repair the road to the city and clear it of stones; raise a banner to help the nations find their way.

11.verse: Here is what the LORD has said for all the earth to hear: “Soon I will come to save the city of Zion, and to reward you.

12.verse: Then you will be called, ‘The LORD’s Own People, The Ones He Rescued!' Your city will be known as a good place to live and a city full of people.”

1.verse: The LORD’s Victory over the Nations - Who is this coming from Bozrah in Edom with clothes stained red? Who is this hero marching in his glorious uniform? “It’s me, the LORD! I have won the battle, and I can save you!”

2.verse: What are those red spots? Your clothes look stained from stomping on grapes.

3.verse: “I alone stomped the grapes! None of the nations helped. I stomped nations in my anger and stained my clothes with their blood.

4.verse: I did this because I wanted to take revenge— the time had come to rescue my people.

5.verse: No one was there to help me or to give support; my mighty arm won the battle, strengthened by my anger.

6.verse: In my fury I stomped on nations and made them drunk; their blood poured out everywhere on earth.”

7.verse: The LORD’s Goodness to His People - I will tell about the kind deeds the LORD has done. They deserve praise! The LORD has shown mercy to the people of Israel; he has been kind and good.

8.verse: The LORD rescued his people, and said, “They are mine. They won’t betray me.”

9.verse: It troubled the LORD to see them in trouble, and his angel saved them. The LORD was truly merciful, so he rescued his people. He took them in his arms and carried them all those years.

10.verse: Then the LORD’s people turned against him and made his Holy Spirit sad. So he became their enemy and attacked them.

11.verse: But his people remembered what had happened during the time of Moses. Didn’t the LORD bring them and their leaders safely through the sea? Didn’t he give them his Holy Spirit?

12.verse: The glorious power of the LORD marched beside Moses. The LORD will be praised forever for dividing the sea.

13.verse: He led his people across like horses running wild without stumbling.

14.verse: His Spirit gave them rest, just as cattle find rest when led into a valley. The name of the LORD was praised for doing these things.

15.verse: A Prayer for Mercy and Help - Please, LORD, look down from your holy and glorious home in the heavens and see what’s going on. Have you lost interest? Where is your power? Show that you care about us and have mercy!

16.verse: Our ancestors Abraham and Jacob have both rejected us. But you are still our Father; you have been our protector since ancient times.

17.verse: Why did you make us turn away from you, our LORD? Why did you make us want to disobey you? Please change your mind! We are your servants, your very own people.

18.verse: For a little while, your temple belonged to us; and now our enemies have torn it down.

19.verse: We act as though you had never ruled us or called us your people.

1.verse: Rip the heavens apart! Come down, LORD; make the mountains tremble.

2.verse: Be a spark that starts a fire causing water to boil. Then your enemies will know who you are; all nations will tremble because you are nearby.

3.verse: Your fearsome deeds have completely amazed us; even the mountains shake when you come down.

4.verse: You are the only God ever seen or heard of who works miracles for his followers.

5.verse: You help all who gladly obey and do what you want, but sin makes you angry. Only by your help can we ever be saved.

6.verse: We are unfit to worship you; each of our good deeds is merely a filthy rag. We dry up like leaves; our sins are storm winds sweeping us away.

7.verse: No one worships in your name or remains faithful. You have turned your back on us and let our sins melt us away.

8.verse: You, LORD, are our Father. We are nothing but clay, but you are the potter who molded us.

9.verse: Don’t be so furious or keep our sins in your thoughts forever! Remember that all of us are your people.

10.verse: Every one of your towns has turned into a desert, especially Jerusalem.

11.verse: Zion’s glorious and holy temple where our ancestors praised you has been destroyed by fire. Our beautiful buildings are now a pile of ruins.

12.verse: When you see these things, how can you just sit there and make us suffer more?

1.verse: The LORD Will Punish the Guilty - I, the LORD, was ready answer even those who were not asking and to be found by those who were not searching. To a nation that refused to worship me, I said, “Here I am!”

2.verse: All day long I have reached out to stubborn and sinful people going their own way.

3.verse: They keep making me angry by sneering at me, while offering sacrifices to idols in gardens and burning incense to them on bricks.

4.verse: They spend their nights hiding in burial caves; they eat the meat of pigs, cooked in sauces made of stuff unfit to eat.

5.verse: And then they say to others, “Don’t come near us! We’re dedicated to God.” Such people are like smoke, irritating my nose all day.

6.verse: I have written this down; I won’t keep silent. I’ll pay them back just as their sins deserve.

7.verse: I, the LORD, will make them pay for their sins and for those of their ancestors— they have disgraced me by burning incense on mountains.

8.verse: Here is what the LORD says: A cluster of grapes that produces wine is worth keeping! So, because of my servants, I won’t destroy everyone.

9.verse: I have chosen the people of Israel and Judah, and I will bless them with many descendants. They will settle here in this land of mountains, and it will be theirs.

10.verse: My people will worship me. Then the coastlands of Sharon and the land as far as Achor Valley will turn into pastureland where cattle and sheep will feed and rest.

11.verse: What will I, the LORD, do if any of you reject me and my holy mountain? What will happen to you for offering food and wine to the gods you call “Good Luck” and “Fate”?

12.verse: Your luck will end! I will see to it that you are slaughtered with swords. You refused to answer when I called out; you paid no attention to my instructions. Instead, you did what I hated, knowing it was wrong.

13.verse: I, the LORD God, will give food and drink to my servants, and they will celebrate. But all of you sinners will go hungry and thirsty, overcome with disgrace.

14.verse: My servants will laugh and sing, but you will be sad and cry out in pain.

15.verse: I, the LORD God, promise to see that you are killed and that my chosen servants use your names as curse words. But I will give new names to my servants.

16.verse: I am God! I can be trusted. Your past troubles are gone; I no longer think of them. When you pray for someone to receive a blessing, or when you make a promise, you must do it in my name. I alone am the God who can be trusted.

17.verse: The LORD’s New Creation - I am creating new heavens and a new earth; everything of the past will be forgotten.

18.verse: Celebrate and be glad forever! I am creating a Jerusalem, full of happy people.

19.verse: I will celebrate with Jerusalem and all of its people; there will be no more crying or sorrow in that city.

20.verse: No child will die in infancy; everyone will live to a ripe old age. Anyone a hundred years old will be considered young, and to die younger than that will be considered a curse.

21.verse: My people will live in the houses they build; they will enjoy grapes from their own vineyards.

22.verse: No one will take away their homes or vineyards. My chosen people will live to be as old as trees, and they will enjoy what they have earned.

23.verse: Their work won’t be wasted, and their children won’t die of dreadful diseases. I will bless their children and their grandchildren.

24.verse: I will answer their prayers before they finish praying.

25.verse: Wolves and lambs will graze together; lions and oxen will feed on straw. Snakes will eat only dirt! They won’t bite or harm anyone on my holy mountain. I, the LORD, have spoken!

1.verse: True Worship - The LORD said: Heaven is my throne; the earth is my footstool. What kind of house could you build for me? In what place will I rest?

2.verse: I have made everything; that’s how it all came to be. I, the LORD, have spoken. The people I treasure most are the humble— they depend only on me and tremble when I speak.

3.verse: You sacrifice oxen to me, and you commit murder; you sacrifice lambs to me and dogs to other gods; you offer grain to me and pigs' blood to idols; you burn incense to me and praise your idols. You have made your own choice to do these disgusting things that you enjoy so much.

4.verse: You refused to answer when I called out; you paid no attention to my instructions. Instead, you did what I hated, knowing it was wrong. Now I will punish you in a way you dread the most.

5.verse: The LORD Will Help Jerusalem - If you tremble when the LORD speaks, listen to what he says: “Some of your own people hate and reject you because of me. They make fun and say, ‘Let the LORD show his power! Let us see him make you truly happy.’ But those who say these things will be terribly ashamed.”

6.verse: Do you hear that noise in the city and those shouts coming from the temple? It is the LORD shouting as he punishes his enemies.

7.verse: Have you ever heard of a woman who gave birth to a child before having labor pains?

8.verse: Who ever heard of such a thing or imagined it could happen? Can a nation be born in a day or come to life in a second? Jerusalem is like a mother who gave birth to her children as soon as she was in labor.

9.verse: The LORD is the one who makes birth possible. And he will see that Zion has many more children. The LORD has spoken.

10.verse: If you love Jerusalem, celebrate and shout! If you were in sorrow because of the city, you can now be glad.

11.verse: She will nurse and comfort you, just like your own mother, until you are satisfied. You will fully enjoy her wonderful glory.

12.verse: The LORD has promised: “I will flood Jerusalem with the wealth of nations and make the city prosper. Zion will nurse you at her breast, carry you in her arms, and hold you in her lap.

13.verse: I will comfort you there like a mother comforting her child.”

14.verse: When you see this happen, you will celebrate; your strength will return faster than grass can sprout. Then everyone will know that the LORD is present with his servants, but he is angry with his enemies.

15.verse: The LORD will come down like a whirlwind with his flaming chariots. He will be terribly furious and punish his enemies with fire.

16.verse: The LORD’s fiery sword will bring justice everywhere on this earth and execute many people.

17.verse: A Threat and a Promise - Some of you get yourselves ready and go to a garden to worship a foreign goddess. You eat the meat of pigs, lizards, and mice. But I, the LORD, will destroy you for this.

18.verse: I know everything you do and think! The time has now come to bring together the people of every language and nation and to show them my glory

19.verse: by proving what I can do. I will send the survivors to Tarshish, Pul, Lud, Meshech, Tubal, Javan, and to the distant islands. I will send them to announce my wonderful glory to nations that have never heard about me.

20.verse: They will bring your relatives from the nations as an offering to me, the LORD. They will come on horses, chariots, wagons, mules, and camels to Jerusalem, my holy mountain. It will be like the people of Israel bringing the right offering to my temple.

21.verse: I promise that some of them will be priests and others will be helpers in my temple. I, the LORD, have spoken.

22.verse: I also promise that you will always have descendants and will never be forgotten, just as the new heavens and the new earth that I create will last forever.

23.verse: On the first day of each month and on each Sabbath, everyone will worship me. I, the LORD, have spoken.

24.verse: My people will go out and look at the dead bodies of those who turned against me. The worms there never die, the fire never stops burning, and the sight of those bodies will be disgusting to everyone.
